extractions.extraction_text: Sparsity comes from a key word called sparse. Sparse means very few.

attributes.definition: Sparsity means very few non-zero values in a dataset.
attributes.simplified_explanation: It means most of the data points are zero or empty.

extractions.extraction_text: If you have the record in e-commerce store, like in Amazon. Your data is sparse in that data record. Because they have millions of the record, but then you probably only buy 10 books before. So make your data in the millions then become very sparse.

attributes.takeaway: E-commerce purchase data is a prime example of sparse data due to the vast number of products versus a customer's limited purchases.

extractions.extraction_text: how to solving them, how to do the resolution, we will talking about later in some of the courses, some of them will be in classification, some of them will be in the text mining.

attributes.takeaway: Techniques for handling sparsity and resolution will be covered in later courses like classification and text mining.

extractions.extraction_text: We want to talk about different type of the data set. We have the data matrix, document data, transaction data.

attributes.definition: Common types of data sets include data matrix, document data, and transaction data.
attributes.simplified_explanation: Data can be organized in different ways, such as a grid (data matrix), collections of text (document data), or lists of purchases (transaction data).

extractions.extraction_text: In the context of e-commerce, why is customer purchase data considered sparse?

attributes.question: In the context of e-commerce, why is customer purchase data considered sparse?
attributes.answer_hint: Consider the total number of items available versus the number of items a single customer buys.

extractions.extraction_text: What are three types of data sets mentioned in the lecture?

attributes.question: What are three types of data sets mentioned in the lecture?
attributes.answer_hint: Think about different ways data can be structured.

text:
sionality (Curse of Dimensionality), Sparsity (Only presence counts), and Resolution (Patterns depend on the scale). A speech bubble says "Later" next to Sparsity.
